context/5: I don´t know what´s so shocking to you
context/6: We have always held duels in this house.
context/7: I will never allow it in my house!
context/8: It´s Pablo Aguirre, the man who came last night and danced with Ana white as marble, he already had dead in his gaze.

context: They were after guns and ammunition.
response: Don't go to sleep cos they'll be back.
context/3: I am from Texas.
context/4: Only if it's a Northern soldier trying to sneak into Texas as a spy.
context/5: Do you ask everyone the same thing?
context/6: What for?
context/7: I'd like a canteen of water
context/9: Have you had any Indian trouble here?

context: Careful where you point that gun.
response: I'm pointing it at a no-good Yankee.
context/1: I made that up to make her go.
context/3: I'll be there in a minute.
context/6: Stella!
context/8: It let all my feelings loose.
context/9: When I saw you come riding in, it was like a dam bursting.

context: We're diving on the first one.
context/0: Only one thing left, drop on them plane and all.
context/3: The giant arm raised, green flash, they're spraying us with flame.
context/4: 1,000 yards and we'll be over the first, 800 yards, 600, 400, 200, there they go.
context/6: The switchboard operator's are about ready to go out of their minds.
context/9: Well, it's three minutes until the break.

context: I'd like to talk to Mrs. Edward Davenport, please.
context/3: I'm sick.
context/4: Well, get him over here right away.
context/6: Dr. Renault.
context/7: Who's the nearest doc around here?
context/8: This is Mr. Davenport in Cabin 6.

context: Came to me all of a sudden, just a little while ago.
response: Made me feel as though we've been blind.
context/2: I've been thinking about it and an idea came to me just now.
context/3: Oh, I don't know.
context/4: I doubt if they ever will.
context/6: Well, seen anything of the murderer?
